title: ISic000509. I.Sicily inscription 000509
body:
Facsimile Images

[Imp(eratori) Caesari]
d(omino) n(ostro) F[l(avio) Valentini-]
ano pio [felici]
semper Aug[usto]
5M(arcus) Valerius
Quintianus
v(ir) c(larissimus) cons(ularis) p(rovinciae) S(iciliae)
clementiae
pietatique eius
10semper dicatis-
simus

Apparatus criticus

Text of Marino 1978

English translation

To the emperor Caesar, our lord Flavius Valentinianus, pious, fortunate, forever Augustus; Marcus Valerius Quintianus, of clarissimus rank, governor (consularis) of the province of Sicilia, most dedicated to his clemency and piety (set this up) [translation of Gehn and Machado, LSA 2063]

commentary

Traces of a probably C3 AD inscription are visible between the final lines

bibliography

    10.7229 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000589 Marino 1978 106-110 no.4 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001760 Machado and Gehn 2014 LSA-2063 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002692
